IzUvMQRNhfaWgzq_OjL8Gw.text: Best place to get breakfast and brunch! If you like spicy food I would go on a Friday or sat they have a special called the special scramble and it's eggs, chorizo, and jalapeno w tortilla on the side! Plus hash brown this special made this place my fav spot now!  hands down a must try!

GdXXM6VMIMLDg2TeMVrB9g.text: Overpriced, underwhelming.... this place tries to make breakfast expensive when it's the cheapest crap around.  No thank you!  IHOP has same food for 1/9th the price

SgcT3Ny0fFdSywxjkrV5dg.text: This is a great spot for breakfast. We took the family here on a Saturday morning around 10am. The wait was about 20-25 minutes for a party of six. The place was packed, so I wasn't surprised. Because it was so cold, everyone was crowded in waiting in the small reception area in the front, but it's Arizona so that can't happen that often.   I got the Five Spot, and when it was coming out, I saw how much bread it was and the "oh no" thoughts were running through my head. But all those thoughts disappeared when I tried it. The bread melted in my mouth and wasn't heavy at all. The bacon and onions on the sandwich were fantastic. My mom got the Salami Scramble, which I tried and the salami was very tasty.   Service was great and everything came out quick and hot.  My brother was the only one who got coffee and said it wasn't that great, but he drank a couple cups, so it couldn't have been that bad.   I can't wait to go back!

j8Fm-9P-ibF88zDat4C0wQ.text: This was one of the worst breakfast experiences we have ever had at a restaurant.  There were so many issues that it's hard to know where to begin.  I guess it all started with a dirty water cup.  Hubby ordered water and I got freshly squeezed OJ.  The water cup had food residue all over it and there was also something floating in the water.  As we were waiting for our food for over 30 minutes, we observed servers giving food to the wrong people on multiple occasions.  We know that we were waiting for our food for over 30 minutes, because I checked in on Yelp right after we ordered so we had a time stamp as a reference.  We also observed the manager scold a server in the middle of the dining room.  The server was visibly mad at him.  When our food came out, the server gave it to the people next to us while we were trying to tell him that it was ours.  It was very obvious that servers did not know table numbers because so many people were given the wrong food.   Hubby and I both ordered the scramble special with Havarti cheese, sausage and spinach.  When we got the food, the eggs were severely overcooked.  There was no cheese in mine nor my husband's scramble.  The potatoes, which I took some photos of, were so charred that it looked like there were chunks of coal in them.  My husband sent his plate back because it was so bad.  When the manager brought out the newly cooked plate of food for him, he tossed it down in front of my husband and said "Here ya go, dude."  NO apology, no nothing.   I have never seen such apathy from a restaurant manager before.    The kitchen was obviously in the weeds the entire time we were there.  There seems to be a huge training issue that spans from the kitchen to management, to the servers.  I think this location has bitten off much more than they can chew.  It's giving MBB a bad reputation.  I have written hundereds of reviews, and I very rarely give a one star review.  MBB earned that one star.

GF2ZY8gmq0d617FlDXRRyg.text: Really disappointed by this place. I heard such good things from multiple people and was completely let down. The management here is horrible and was hard to watch. For some reason they have a huge patio that is used as a waiting area instead of set up for service. We waited 45 mins to be seated for a table of 3 and multiple times during that time I witnessed tables cleared and ready to be sat to have the manager who was calling guests let the table sit empty for 10 to 15 minutes. The food and Bloody Mary I had was pretty good but not good enough to make up for the aggravation of inefficiency and having to spend 2 hours for a breakfast that would of taken an hour tops anywhere else.

KyVtYyiOuwGV7K8NTpdb8w.text: The visit to their Rio Salado location began with frustration. We stood around for 15 minutes with no hostess or waitress even acknowledging us. Because it's such a pain to get to this location, we stuck it out to finally try this fabled restaurant. I ordered the Friday special, basically a deconstructed breakfast burrito, and my lady ordered the hog and chick, sausage and potatoes and scrambled eggs. The food was okay, and the price was comparable to any other yuppie brunch spot that feels the need to advertise things like "cage-free". The mimosa was alright, but the Gin Rickey was made with a lemon instead of a lime. Overall they seemed under staffed. Will not be returning, but I don't think I'll need to. I don't think this place will be here long.

3Mnw2oPU0MSQcyhO4eTZdw.text: Matts is my most favorite breakfast place. With the new Tempe location I'll be visiting more often. Great food, very reasonably priced and very friendly staff. Can't say enough good things about this place

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. The inside of the new Matts Big Breakfast on Rio Salado Pkwy in Downtown Tempe,AZ.  Food is great. Price is very reasonable.

XNVwVTIM-skOvPr9r6aSyg.text: I've been in love with Matts since my first visit to the Phoenix location! The food is delicious, the service is fantastic, and it has, in my opinion, the most delicious breakfast served anywhere. I'm so happy they've expanded to Tempe.  I would recommend The Chop and Chick as a great place to get a sampling of savory heaven. The pork chop is seasoned perfectly and is a perfect example of being tender yet firm. The eggs are always sublime, and the home fries will never disappoint.  If you've got a sweet tooth, the pancakes or the waffle are also delicious. I'd kill for their batter recipe.  Will continue to keep coming back for more

kEVWXJkA8-u0K5zapPbfNA.text: Hats off, gents. You've done it, squeezing a bonafide breakfast gem right in between an insurance building and a lake. I'll admit, I'm charmed, not by your $4.50 orange juice, but by your attention to breakfast mainstays. Nobody hashes a brown quite like Matt's.

296Af0mhZiCJ4cWZHOPdQw.text: Hands down, the best breakfast in town. The biscuits have spoiled me for all others. I wish they were always available

9kg5CBosbNGwpofsOqkt1g.text: I decided to try something different, and I'm so glad I stopped by. My wife and I both had the Saturday Special Scramble. The egg, chorizo and jalapeno peppers were cooked perfectly. Great flavor with just the right amount of heat! The coffee was good and our server was kind and thoughtful. I will definitely be back!

unD-qv4wbD0qFljD7dVxHQ.text: Lunch there too! New location in Tempe. Great stop after a long run around TTL. I went for the turkey rouben. Friend went all out breakfast: pancakes with a gigantic omelet. Do not eat here often. But I've never been disappointed.

lbODnFW1gyItrFY7JNnlRg.text: WOW!  We haven't been to Matt's Big Breakfast in ages... and that was in downtown Phoenix.  Since they have more recently set up a place close to our home, we made it today!   The location is part of the Rio Salado complex on Tempe Town Lake.  Very beautiful day and location.  Parking was interesting, only because 2 out of the 3 of us are gimpy.  So while there, I asked how to park closer and that was very helpful.      Our server was Daniel.  If I could hire someone, it would be Daniel in a heartbeat!  He was kind, thoughtful, friendly and there for everything we needed.  The coffee...  well, I loved it!  It is hearty and isn't the watered-down version of coffee that most places serve.  ("Roastery of Cave Creek. Ground daily.")       Two of us had "The Hog & Chick" with 2 eggs, toast, hash browns or homefries, and meat.  I had it scrambled, white toast, sausage patties and hash browns.  It was perfection plus strawberry preserves!  Everyone ate everything!  Our friend had the waffle and bacon... the first words out of her mouth were "OH MY GOD!" after her bite of bacon.  She kept looking at it and chewing and she could not believe it was that good.  All of us loved loved loved the meal and the attentiveness of Daniel.       I must also mention the person that cooked our great breakfast, Forest!  I met him at the counter and I must give hats off to the person who hired these guys!  Forest did a great job, because each of us wanted to lick our plates.      We will be back.

qQb3y6lHpphU8DSA-TWD6g.text: I wanted to come here because it's close to my house and the gym I became a member at. I walked in with my girlfriend, there were two spots open at the bar and 2 or 3 tables open, we didn't wanna wait behind the two people waiting and no one was at the counter. So, we decided to sit at the bar, ever place I've ever been the bar is open, we sat down, looked at the menu only but a second and a mar came up to us very loudly and said "there are two people in front of you, you can't sit here". Mind you there were several tables open and the two people in front of us had been sitting there waiting. Was very unprofessional to announce it like that and since when is the bar part of seating? I'll avoid this place and take my business elsewhere, I understand this might be minor, but when there are multiple places open and you disrespect customers, it's never ok.

nLc2oB6GEPYyAda3K6xtGQ.text: I would like to share my recent experience dining at this establishment.  To give you a bit of background, I found Matt's Big Breakfast off Yelp months ago and my sister and I visited the location they have in downtown Phoenix.  I read the reviews and although most people spoke about the long wait time, but how worth it to still visit, was definitely something worth trying out.  I absolutely fell IN LOVE with the breakfast that I had (salami scramble w/cheese, side of sausage and home fries ...bomb.com)  I've visited that location twice and never had a problem.  Recently I was visiting my sister in the East Valley of Phoenix and she began craving Matt's Big Breakfast.  I said, Ok...let's do it.  To my surprise they have a new location that opened up about 10 months ago (I was told) and we were excited about trying it out.  Here are the Pro's and Con's:  Pro's:  This location is much bigger than the location downtown.  I loved the scenery, the waterfall and the outside seating.  I absolutely love the open kitchen which allows you to watch your food being made.  Our server Michelle was AMAZING (more details about her in a bit).  Con's:  We were served our drinks in plastic cups and not glasses like everyone else.  My sister elected to order the Steak and Eggs breakfast, but she could not because they ran out of steak.  It would have been nice to know this information when we were given our menus to look over.  It's on the menu, so how come you don't have it available for a customer to purchase?  She then selected home fries, cheesy eggs and 3 pancakes.  She did not like the pancakes.  I again ordered my usual, salami scramble with home fries and side of sausage.  My home fries came out cold.  I asked the waiter if they could give me some more and they used a top broiler of some kind to heat it up because they do not have a microwave.  When our server Michelle came by to ask how our food was, I told her that it was just alright, nothing special.  After telling her what was wrong, she immediately took my plate away without further request and had them remake the whole meal.  She explained to me that my happiness is what matters to her and that is what I call some damn good customer service.  When my plate arrived, my potatoes were hot, cheese melted on my salami scramble.  That remake, but most importantly her eagerness to satisfy me is what allowed me to give this place a 2 star.  I hoped that my experience would have been better because this location is close to my job and I would have planned to visit more.  Would I go again, probably not.  I would travel to the downtown location if I ever crave Matt's again.  I hope that one day I can update my review with something much better for this location if I do visit again  They seem to be new and getting things together so I won't bash them for that.  I wish them the best and hope it gets better.

WpUC4RvZ_D4TZK3pCuTUdA.text: Attentive and creative service is hard to come by these days. This 5 star is mostly as a result of the service provided by Michelle. After looking over the menu which seemed pretty limited I had made up my mind that I'd just enjoy the amazing coffee at Matt's and opt for a short ride to Snooze instead for food. I let Michelle know that nothing really stood out so I'd take my check for the coffee. She said with a warm smile "Is there something you were looking for? I'm sure we can make you happy!" I told  her I was a fan of a skillet type of breakfast. She immediately said she could do that and started making recommendations on what to include in it. Just seemed to genuinely care about making me happy with a great breakfast which kicked my Friday off perfectly. Off-menu skillet was great Michelle! Matt's lucky to have you:)

vUvc77NOCrLP7y7wW7lOCQ.text: Had an amazing breakfast, staff was very friendly and price was reasonable. Steak & eggs um good.

Thg6Z650jqNexroUI2DMbA.text: Bomb.com anyone who doesn't give this place five stars is insane! Service is great and the food never disappoints.

pGY7sqfma9doyV2LiRaedw.text: One of my favorite places to grab breakfast or lunch in PHX!  So glad they're in Tempe now, too. Went with coworkers today and it was so good, everyone loved what they ordered. Our large group was served efficiently as well. Be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States

XvpnuAulNpwZntMaudbPwA.text: I was so excited to be in the area after seeing Matt's Big Breakfast on the Food Channel years ago. I ordered waffles which I will say to my surprise very light and fluffy.  My boyfriend ordered bacon sausage and eggs. Nothing spectacular, a bit over priced my one waffle with no sides was almost $8. I'm glad I tried it but was not overly impressed.

lGoytEIzcamGXBPt8OFrEw.text: After waiting 30 minutes and being the 4th person on the list to get seated, when asked if we could sit at the bar where there were at least 10 seats open we were told that they couldn't seat anyone at the bar because the kitchen was behind. What?? If you're behind tell the patrons up front. Too bad we actually went out of our way to eat here.

MQoUFaDMoVFe9SAt-Dpa4Q.text: My friends and I stopped here for Saturday brunch after the gym.  The place wasn't very busy for being Saturday morning. It was open and airy - great atmosphere. Food was okay. It was exactly what you'd expect from a generic breakfast place. I had The Skinny, but subbed hash browns for the salad. The egg white, chicken sausage, and kale scramble was good. The hashbrowns were a little soggy.  Why I gave this place two stars was because of the service. Our server, Michelle, was a total bitch. Every question we had, she answered like we were incredibly stupid. We felt like a complete burden to her. In addition to her, the manager gave us weird, creepy vibes. Won't be coming back.

i6PDzK4m_eGg57gEJCOQYw.text: So, this place is hidden so it was a little hard to find but when I finally found it there weren't very many parking spaces available. So, I found one and walked over and noticed there is no sign or anything explaining what to do because when you get there you walk through a little gate and there are people sitting at tables outside and inside people are sitting and eating. We sat at the table outside for about 15 min before being told we had to get our names on the wait list.... so we did and the wait was long. We were finally seated inside and they don't have much variety so we ordered and my companion got a side of hash browns that came out looking like green ramen noodles. The food was mediocre and the server was getting really friendly with my companion. Wasn't terrible but wasn't great, I probably wouldn't go back

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States

D2X58JVbIdS8MR-zsTRwOw.text: Let me preface that I am 6'4" and 275lbs so when I found Matt's Big Breakfast I felt at home.   I had a waffle and two strips of bacon.   The Bacon was excellent and the waffle was nice and crisp.   The reason for the 2 star rating was related to the "Big" reference.  I had different expectations obviously.  So I ordered eggs on the side, 4 to be exact.  I asked the waitress for some more syrup for my waffle as the portion served was meager to be kind.  It was explained that it came from Vermont so I was only getting the portion that was previously provided but I could have blueberry preserves if I wanted something else.  I asked the cost of more syrup and I opted to try the Blueberry preserves.  I don't remember the exact quoted amount but it seemed excessive as my check was already just shy of $20.00 and that is just drinking water.    For what it is worth the location and convenience was great.  The food was tasty and the waitress was great.  I was just expecting more from "Big" breakfast.

lAg1uXwBPMghm7z0RUBDBw.text: Eggs were good.  The hash browns were saturated in oil. The toast wasn't.  Just warmed bread.  Coffee was ok. Nothing special. Overall?  Meh

FgwFJSbvgiXTsGnBAMsJAg.text: 1st time trying this place...hopes were very high sadly our experience wasn't great.   3 stars   -Service was alright  -food we ordered (the chop & chick) was dry -the coffee wasn't good as well tasted very bitter...we paid for our meal wish it was better.

usmNRA20eNO2wwV2IBDrdg.text: Sleep is really the time machine to breakfast and Matt's is a great spot to take your sleepy head for breakfast. I'm a fan of the Phoenix location but this one is perfect for a bike ride along Tempe Town Lake and nestled among the beauty of Marina Heights. Once inside, it's sleek and modern with colorful chalk drawings displaying. I like the short menu so you aren't overloaded on those hangover mornings. There are a variety of specials each day of the week but I stuck to the waffles....something about those airy pillows of carb goodness had me. If the freshly brewed STRONG coffee from the Roastery of Cave Creek doesn't perk you up, the bellini and margarita are pretty delish good eye openers. Just a note, there's few 5 tops (3 to be exact) so not the easiest to accommodate large parties. You MUST have all people present to be seated. Or if you can squeeze in, sit at the bar and gab with a few Sun Devils. The waiting area is spacious on the outdoor patio that you can stalk the diners to hurry and finish up! Parking is pretty easy and they will validate for the garage. And if you've overindulged, just walk steps to the gym across the yard or take a quick run around the lake.

EZxTwlSs4Jg9t96JBcmlEw.text: I enjoyed it, the family wasn't impressed. I'm a bit of a breakfast snob so when the kids and wife pressure me to go to Denny's, I turn up my nose and refuse to be a party to such heathenism. I ordered the chop and chick. The eggs were undercooked (wife and I ordered over medium)I made due because the toast was no lie, 2" thick, so I had plenty of real estate to mop up the runny whites and yolk. The pork chop was good, but I really enjoyed the home fries which much to my surprise were grilled up with fresh rosemary. Don't get the hash browns you will be disappointed. The family wasn't impressed by the thick cut locally farm raised bacon or the cage free eggs, or the fresh squeezed orange juice. Hell even the ketchup was non GMO. Oh well... On to the next, I refuse to give into the big breakfast corporate juggernauts.

EP63UfE2Yuf7YPsCERhlMQ.text: The food is always amazing!!! There are a few servers that exceed expectations every single time and one of those individuals is Daniel. Always greeting customers with a friendly smile and  concerned about the entire experience rather than just the meal. Love coming here!!

G7Nml_fAyw85vvgy7ViScg.text: My wife and I came here for brunch today and to try the place out, as I've heard good things about MBB. I have nothing good to say about our visit today, except our waitress was friendly and apologetic about the "food" we were served. We both ordered the special today, eggs benedict, being today's special you'd think they'd have it down. No. Such. Luck. My plate was FULL of water that my food swam around in. My potatoes swimming and cold, the hollandaise was cool and thick, my eggs hard boiled. My wife's plate was about the same, just a little less water, her hash browns dry and tasteless. We shared our concerns with our server who told us she would speak to the manager, she then comped our main dishes...We never spoke to the manager. My guess is they don't care all that much. On the way out we were already nauseous and my wife went to use the filthy, unstocked ladies room with the broken door to add insult to injury I suppose. I guess the positive ratings come from employees?? I'll go to Denny's before Matt's sees a nickle of my hard earned cash.

loxQhdPQ-ge_Obh_fSL6fQ.text: Perfect!! Order matched instructions. Nice, clean location.  And Blakey is a great waitress!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States

n9IBzmeIUEBTeZhUfQpn_g.text: Every bit as good as what you've come to expect from Matt's Big Breakfast but in newer and bigger digs! Team service never leaves you hanging, anyone can get anything for you and everyone is super friendly. The food is as good as the day they opened, still wish they had the green eggs and ham though! Will be back as it is closer and did I mention bigger, with a lovely patio to boot!

onamNUcMBqpENsANA0w5zA.text: First time checking out this location.   Went on a Saturday around 10:30am so expected to wait. Manager quoted us 30-45 minutes. Lots of open seating which made it seem understaffed.   Waited about 30 minutes.   Service was meh. She greeted us quick but not friendly. Kept up on water refills but didn't check on us too much after we got our food.   We waited about 20-25 minutes for our food. Boyfriend ordered the special which was a three egg scramble with pork tenderloin, Fresno peppers and Cabot white cheddar served with a tortilla and home fries. He requested home fries extra crispy and they came out super soft. There were two tiny pieces of the Fresno peppers in the scramble and the pork tenderloin was roughly chopped into large pieces with little to no flavor. Pretty bland.   I ordered the five spot with a side of hash browns. Both of mine were absolutely delicious but very greasy. They may have confused the "crispy" request for my hash browns but they turned out great.   Took a while for our server to get us our check and a box. Bathroom was out of paper towels. Overall just not a great experience. I'll definitely return but either during the week or earlier on the weekend.

wjc5D-hTTxt4um-C6o13OQ.text: I really enjoy eating at Matt's and have been to the original downtown location about 11 years ago, the Tempe location, and surprise the airport. I am a creature of habit when I eat out for breakfast. Two eggs over medium , ham, hash browns crispy and dry sourdough. Matts cooks my eggs perfectly, the ham is never salty and the hash browns crispy and brown. I love the sourdough and house smashed strawberry jam. Consistently consistent. Great job to Matt's crew members

SkWsMqcdj7pnh2zSu_FYaQ.text: Michael was the best waiter ever! Early morning flight that was an issues but eatting here and having Michael as our waiter was great. The food was really good but even if it was bad the service was ON POINT. THANK YOU for a wonderful exsperience!

-VY5W_XC7aUOwi5GuCQhZw.text: Does anyone else have mega love for their patio? The food and service is always on point, it's the homestyle hospitality that gives you all the mom-and-pop feels! And the hash browns, so so so good. Definitely recommend for a no-fuss breakfast in Tempe!

D7UA6SpU3NTg-uwI3pYyuA.text: My potatoes were swimming in olive oil. Service was great but limited menu compared to other breakfast places in the area.

sN7g-VfUh0GxgQxehdgU7Q.text: I enjoyed the atmosphere of Matt's Big Breakfast near Tempe Town Lake...however, that's about all I can say for the place. The food was mediocre at best, not even as good as an omelette you might order at a Denny's or IHOP.  They brought us over coffee as soon as we sat, without asking if we wanted it (at first we thought this was a nice gesture, until two coffees popped up on our bill later).  For a breakfast joint located in Arizona, the hottest salsa they have is Tapatio- they don't even carry Chiluba or Tabasco for heavens sake (sacrilegious in my book).  Also, I must say that the menu was quite small; I felt that there were very few options, it was almost too easy to decide which entree to order.

8S3b95miOGkq8RLD7mqY4w.text: Had lunch there. My wife thought the club was great.  I had the Ruben.  No taste to the sauerkraut and the 1000 dressing was very runny and not very good.  If we go back maybe We'll stick to breakfast.  Went to the one on Rio Saladin.  Parking is a nightmare to say that least

RMQIfp5CjWnPlX447zJh4A.text: Pancakes very good coffee a tad rich for my taste. Staff helpful. Atmosphere awesome with open doors on a great a day . Would come again

WlIzyIggI4E13wZBE-5S0A.text: Good food but service always slow and they charge extra for everything. The pancakes are great by th syrup they give is small amount and if you ask for extra the charge $1.50

gSi6BVX17YbpqUkzEDnSLg.text: The owner Matt has a very stupid rule of no substitutions on his meals and offers really no options for people who don't eat pork even the chicken sausage has pork casing. Luckily the manager Jason is very helpful and friendly and accommodated us in every way. I would have given this place a 1 star if it wasn't for Jason.

yR663-BkYcBBnpdxqut9YQ.text: This is one of those places that you drive by all the time, thinking "Man, I should try that place." but never get around to it. Today I finally stopped by with some friends and I am SO glad I did. Matt's is a perfect early-bird breakfast stop with plenty of options for everyone. The waffles are crack and the hash browns are meth

VNmuqmL2IdiVpe-e1QoMMw.text: Had a great first experience at the Tempe location. It's located on the ground floor of one of the business buildings in the Marina, wasn't where I expected but decent signage helped me find my way. You have to park in a parking garage but during the weekdays first 2 hours are free so that's nice and it was easy parking. Matt's is a big, open restaurant. Went on Wednesday and it wasn't very crowded, service was great! Our server kept checking in without checking too much as we talked a lot before we ordered. I ordered the Salami Scramble as I saw someone raving about on Yelp! I know why! It was delicious, awesome fresh bread! They use a lot of locally produced food. I'll definitely go again when I'm in Tempe

The only problem I've seen is sometime they get a little backed up and the service can lack but that's all fixable. Good job overall.

aRPBBoOUErgq1iCgysyrbQ.text: They have a great menu - griddle cakes are the best, delicious coffee, and super nice staff! I would go every morning if I could!

O321zuXF5jcsNaWi9yE-4w.text: I love going out for breakfast and this place is definitely in my top 5 favorite restaurants to go to. My friends and I are never dissatisfied with our food. Not too long of a wait. The staff is upbeat and always there to answer your questions.

gThXqg3XM9C8BCJzqAWnWw.text: Food is just ok. Service is slow and unorganized. Disappointing, had higher expectations. Also they never pick up the phone.

GqhdYUx3HtywB-LmL5-FnA.text: Brand new building and the only baby changing table is in the women's restroom.

HXbS-nU8DeIAnd5-bLq0DQ.text: This place is a hidden between a bunch of building. Looks really high end and hoity-toity.   First impression not bad but waiting for a table is crazy. Not sure why the long wait since there was about ten of us (not in the same party) waiting. Yet they had a bunch of table open. Half needed to be cleaned ample staff but no one cleaning them. A lot of confusion here. The organization of this place is very odd.  Great service to be honest but bud clean it up and not look like you just rolled out of bed with his bed head. They really skimped out on the egg because I literally have a few pieces of egg that don't equivalent to a whole egg. D6H7b6-iRvRutYxFPq3JFw.text: Wow this place is great! The menu isn't huge, but what they do offer comes out well executed and delicious!  I had the waffle: crispy outside, so light and fluffy on the inside, real maple syrup (makes a huge difference) and a side of thick cut peppered bacon. YUM. That bacon is insane and I love the crust of pepper on it.  I also tasted some of the Chop and Chick, also delicious and well seasoned. One of my favorite things were the hash browns though, they were so crispy and flavorful (not sure what they seasoned them with though).  Highly recommend!

s5-A8lT7aIyLb3HALPe-nQ.text: Stopped by here for a quick breakfast with a couple of friends the other day. The service was definitely a little slow but the food was very good. I had eggs and toast and the coffee was very solid. All in all I would say if you need a quick breakfast and you don't mind waiting a little bit then you're going to be happy.

Z12T2I66MmwBrUNCvE1H-Q.text: I'd heard so much about Matt's and couldn't wait to try it. I was surprised that the place wasn't full during lunch. I expected to at least have a short wait since I'd heard how popular Matt's is.  We went out for lunch knowing we'd have breakfast. Service was good but I was underwhelmed with the selection. Yeah, I know, it's breakfast. My egg sandwich was just average as well. My colleagues' meals looked good and maybe I just made the wrong choice. I'm not sure I'd try this place again. If we're in the area, maybe.   Tip: for those not working in one of the buildings at this location, there is parking just north of Matt's don't try this before attempting to park in the structure. We happened to luck out.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Drink menu
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States

NQa5bL4og5-KWKcrtgIwxA.text: Matt loves Big Breakfasts and he cannot lie.  (You other brothers can't deny) --Rejected Sir Mix a Lot lyrics  I've had Matt's bookmarked for a long time and had the morning off so we decided to try this spot out. The restaurant is in a commercial building complex almost exclusively consisting of State Farm Insurance around the Tempe Town Lake area. Parking was easier than I thought. Once you enter the Marina Heights garage there's a sign that tells you where customers can park, and the garage offers your first two hours of parking for free.   Once you get to the restaurant there's a takeout entrance and the regular entrance. The regular entrance is a bit weird in that you have to go through the patio to enter the front door.   I had the scramble daily special. It consisted of fluffy eggs, leaf spinach, lightly sweet Niman Ranch apple chicken sausage, and Havarti cheese. You have your choice of potato and toast- I chose home fries and sourdough. The home fries were perfectly seasoned and delicious. I also enjoyed the sourdough toast.  I had a bite of the salami scramble with hash browns. The salami was cut in long chunky strips and tasted good with the eggs. The hash browns were nice and crispy but were waaay overseasoned. It was too salty for my tastes and when we flipped the pile of hash browns over we noticed that the entire bottom portion was totally coated with their salt/pepper mix which explains the overseasoning.   Prices were reasonable for the quality of food we got. I appreciate that they use sustainable and more humanely raised meats, and that to go boxes are in compostable containers.  So if you're in the Tempe Town Lake area and want breakfast, at Matt's, this Breakfast Got Back!

p_5NPRGmfacm47Pn2lFLkQ.text: Solid place in Tempe to grab a good breakfast. Pancakes were good. Hash browns tasted ok, to much butter. Pepper bacon was a nice touch. Second time now visiting,overall really decent choice

qB5AXoM0m1m9UQpWuVTcog.text: I can't think of a recent better breakfast, maybe Portland's Original House of Pancakes, with its hour wait.  Matt's is beautiful and the food is bountiful and fresh Something for everyone!

RWlUaWbhKrjrknbulKOeow.text: I would really, really like to give Matt's more stars, but this place just doesn't do it for me (and trust me - I've been back three times in hopes of a better experience!).   Ambiance: Great! Trendy and modern, and the Marina Heights scenery is GORGEOUS! But...I wish they utilized the space a bit better. We're in the peak of patio/outdoor seating in Phoenix, and Matt's enormous patio continues to go unused with no tables or outdoor seating options!   Food: Standard. It's really good, simple fare. But...I could make it in my own kitchen (that's how simple it is). They use fresh ingredients that are sustainably sourced, so I have peace of mind there, but the menu is limited, and again - I could make lots of what they serve at home in under ten minutes.   Service: ...wish it was better. It's not that the servers are rude (and again, we've been three times, so I've seen a decent sample of what's to offer), but they don't always feel the most hospitable. I've gone long lengths of time with an empty water glass or coffee cup, and find myself flagging down waitstaff to add items to my tab. I've seen food delivered to the wrong table multiple times, and overall, just don't see the service team working well together.   So, the wrap-up is that this is a great place to try if you're not on a budget and are in the mood for a simple, no-frills breakfast meal. Expect to wait a little, spend a bit, and walk away satisfied but not blown away. Could be a great place to stop if you're taking a stroll on ASU's Tempe Campus or in the Marina Heights neighborhood and are wanting a bite!

R6b8xW_x2d6FhiCzyjaa8g.text: I love Matt's Big Breakfast! It's my favorite breakfast eatery. This new location is so big and has a cool design. I remember when it used to be one teenie tiny restaurant in midtown Phoenix, and now they've expanded to multiple locations. I love going to this Tempe location. They source only the best ingredients. The food is SO good. I always get the classic Hog and Chick. I typically don't eat bacon, but their bacon is so thick and well seasoned. They're homemade jellies are delish as well.

SYWObWEkRWWMPuNulXggmw.text: Jesus Matt, get your establishment together. Place is maybe 55% full, open tables and seats everywhere. Plenty of open bar spots and you're telling me those are reserved and it's going to be 1 hour 20 minute wait minimum? Am I on crazy pills or do you just not want business.

Jt-zIcw3VrXjCNlr3s832g.text: I came in one Sunday to celebrate my birthday and the Sunday special on the paper placemat was steak and eggs. I didn't pay much attention to it until the table next to me ordered it and it looked amazing!!! So I try to go every Sunday every once in a while to get my steak and eggs when I'm sure they serve it other days of the week. The food here is really good, the atmosphere is awesome and the location is prime! The only reason why Matt's Big Breakfast didn't get their fifth star is because honestly the service isn't good. It's not awful but it takes a while to get greeted. I did a takeout order today and it took some time to even get some attention for that.

JhOl-wGbEaJ5DIZ7wYypFA.text: I always do jogging at Tempe Town Marina area and friend of mine mentioned this restaurant earlier. So I decided to try their breakfast Sunday morning. It wasn't too busy when I got there and ordered mine. Food was amazing and perfect temperatures!!!! Coffee was good! I recommend this restaurant for breakfast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States

OfVSHsb8tWUdYLJsGuHNBA.text: Arrived for the first time here at MBB!! I agree with the others that there is no sign to say be seated or seat yourself. We also stood for a bit... then I asked. Yes sit anywhere!!  We found a nice table and we were greeted by a nice man named Blake. Ordered iced tea and he told of the days special. Went to get our drinks and another friendly young lady came by for our drink order!!  Love this!! Better to have too much attention then none!!  Iced tea was amazing.  Husband ordered a cheese omelette with home fries ( caramelized onions and rosemary) and a cup of chili.  I ordered the waffle that comes with Pepper bacon. Omelette came out with hash browns.... oops.... quick fix. Boom they are back with the wonderful potato's!  Food was Amazing . Service outstanding!  Blake told us of other great things to order next time we are there!  Can't wait!!

sCw97K0y_QLG4OWH_FsDSQ.text: Hubs and I came here after a bit so great experience at another restaurant. We've always seen long lines at the downtown location so he wanted to try it. We went 45 minutes before closing and were immediately seated! Our food came out pretty quickly and was fairly good.  My waffle was decent and my eggs were really good. I asked for the cheese to be mixed in while cooking but I think it's a concept restaurants here can't grasp. Despite me specifically asking for it to be mixed in and not on top, it always ends up that way. I asked for my hash brown to be fried hard, and it was, but only on the outside. The inside of my hash brown was extremely mushy with the consistency of  mashed potatoes (which is my all time least favorite food). My hubs ordered the pancakes and I gave him the bacon that came with my dish. He was able to work his way through most of it but they were really big. Something to consider if your get full fast like me.  Overall, this is a cute restaurant with great service. Just stay away from the hash browns if you hate mashed potatoes.

6dZ-Sl0sOaclZ3M1OrYGfQ.text: Truly, a Find. Delicious, simple, ample, well prepared food. Thick, juicy pork chop with fresh eggs, house made thick toast and house made strawberry preserves. The rosemary home fries are the best I've had anywhere. Great staff all around- Alexas is a joy.  Already considering returning for a late lunch.

YLPc71vWc29mA1_N8_pPMg.text: I've had Matt's before and I wasn't impressed because all the meat, but I gave it another try at the advice of a friend and this time was so much better! Plus the wait time at this location was zero on a Saturday morning at 9am! That's pretty much a miracle for MBB!  I am vegetarian for the most part and I'm the only one I know that hates bacon (I know, I know). So after I told our waitress my food restrictions, she suggested the hash w/veggies with an egg on top. YUM! We also had a stack of their pancakes with real maple syrup. They were delicious! The service was great--our very attentive waitress, Michelle, made sure our order and our checks were correct (we were in a group of 7 people and we split checks).  Minus a star because a busser took our pancake plate before we could down the last bites. Maybe they are inexperienced at it and didn't realize they should just ask, "hey, can i take your plate?" Other than the over-eager bussers, the staff was nice, chairs and table were comfortable, our waitress was awesome, and the food was delicious!

VVd6GRIzpMsYNzMQt-oCJQ.text: Okay hear me out: I think Matt's Big Breakfast is overrated.   There's always a long wait to get in, so I assumed that people were waiting so long because it had to be good. So I finally stuck it out and waited, and boy was I underwhelmed.   Once seated, our server took almost 15 minutes to get to our table. When she did finally greet our table, she didn't say anything but hi before walking off again. Didn't ask us what we want to drink or anything.   When we did order, I got the five spot. It was really, really greasy. Additionally, my friend who ordered "extra crispy" hashbrowns got soggy fries instead. It was just upsetting because we had waited close to an hour to get in, and then the service was lackluster and the food was subpar.   I will say that their jam and toast was delicious, and my friend enjoyed her coffee. However, I think there are better places to spend your weekend morning than at Matt's Big Breakfast.

0z4JjS8ayWZpKgkglth7mg.text: Matt's BB is the perfect spot for breakfast. The food is exceptional and the service even better. All of the servers are great but Janiel is the best. You won't be disappointed.

_cgJK9AeXplwhy9BeAhbCA.text: Some of the staff at this location is lame as f... the food is trash. I'd recommend the downtown location if you're looking to get your money's worth.

7gYgImz6sF3HxfiZSs7OWw.text: I was really exited about dining here when I saw the location and the interior of the restaurant. It's ultra modern and bright. However, the food is mediocre at best which was disappointing. The wait staff are inattentive.. even when it was quiet while i visited. They're far from short staffed. Probably won't be back. SjOdoZGCfITUWjmZFtFM9g.text: I asked for poached eggs,  he brought me scrambled, after a long wait, he came back with COLD poached eggs. Ugh.  No excuse for that.  Also he said "I'll take care of that for you" and it was not removed from the bill.  Unimpressed!  The potatoes and the toast were good but that's about it.

T-UY_UUbddrT8FH45NPS-g.text: The food was prepared with an overbearing amount of seasoning. My side of potatoes had more rosemary in them than actual potatoes. Also the bacon is cut thick but has an unbearable amount of pepper on the sides.

QZ16hCwWXp9qip_7Y4y_Rw.text: Well drove in from Scottsdale to see what the big hype is over this restaurant and all I could say was "read the menu". If you don't order the meal by name everything is ala cart a ham and egg breakfast came out to be $16 instead of $12.95, ordered a Reuben sandwich that comes with chips and if u substitute for Cole slaw or Mac salad it $2 more but when I was asked what I would like as a side the waitress never said the Mac salad was an upcharge she just told me my choices. TKDrer6XgAW26Yth7IZLYQ.text: Awesome breakfast spot. The home fries were amazing. Had fresh rosemary on them. Get some fresh juice and the coffee was spot on.

B2vosQZp-6JeH_sU0Mqtng.text: After a 45 minute wait we (party of 5) were seated at a good table...service was great, food was great, management not so great.  My daughter and a friend came in to join us toward the end of our breakfast...we asked if a chair could be added to our table...manager said no...very loudly and drawing attention to our table, that they could not join our party bc it wouldn't be fair to those who had been waiting.  We asked for a chair so she could sit with us. We understood the reason why she couldn't order, but his grandstanding in the restaurant was impolite & unprofessional.  After upsetting my daughter, my wife went to speak to him about how he handled the situation...rather than hear our concern regarding how he embarrassed a teenaged customer with his grandstanding, he proceeded to argue his point and justify his actions...he finally relented and offered an apology.  Fast forward 4 days, same teenaged daughter goes to breakfast w friends.  One of the party drops the check tray and it breaks....same manager gets upset and asks if the young lady had $32 to pay for the broken check tray...not joking, not playing around, but with the same arrogant and impatient attitude displayed just 4 days prior.  The place has great food and the service has been good each time we visited Matt's.  But this one manager's attitude, arrogance, and actions will keep us from visiting the Tempe location in the future.

OTopPCwl6FLtmfaJHTlG8g.text: The name is misleading, not a bog portion at all. Plus horrible service each time I've gone. I work in the same complex. I called takeout and the guy asked for 10-15 min. I did some work and went to get my breakfast. The loud mouthed host who took my order did several rounds of coffee to the guests before greeting me. I stood at the counter for a good 5-10 minutes. No apology when he did, only wanted my name and money. I proceeded to wait patiently for another 20 minutes two people behind me ordered and were served. The host/manger then asked me for my name again and checked the takeout shelf. It had been sitting there the whole time. When I got back to my desk the food was cold. Not worth the $13 for the special. This is the last time I go and I haven't been impressed with the place since it opened. Support another breakfast joint and avoid this location.

HZrxIbf3OufwnG6gl9F2MQ.text: Great breakfast spot for dine in and take out.  Try the daily special.  The Tempe location is a gem.

NnEJyCK1EKecnVCjUNwDcQ.text: This place is truly THE BEST breakfast spot. My daughter and I drove 45 minutes just to try it out and it was more than worth it. It has a nice vibe and a welcoming hello when you walk in. I had the Tuesday Special, biscuits and gravy with eggs and home fries plus I had a side of bacon. My daughter had the Hog and Chick (eggs, sausage patties, hash browns and toast). The biscuits and gravy was the best I've ever had, the bacon was delicious, I don't normally like sausage but the sausage was amazing, the hash browns and home fries were perfect, the toast is apparently delivered daily and it's wonderful. Oh, and the fresh squeezed OJ and lemonade was actually FRESH SQUEEZED! Our server was great and the managers were all friendly and made sure our visit was perfect!  I will definitely be back, especially on Tuesday's for the biscuits and gravy.

MyVmms-mxLmrTy5e-ol9Ag.text: A huge waste of time.  The host guy was funny to watch, but not at all effective in getting tables turned and seated, and seems to believe his low level job gives him a pass to be rude to customers. I'm fairly sure they intentionally stretch out the wait to create a False sense of demand and hype.  There were always 3-4 empty tables while cranky people waited as if at the DMV.  The food is fine, service is a bit awkward and certainly nothing worth putting up with their complete lack of urgency.  It makes customers upset to feel like there's no priority in taking care of them.  Hospitality 101 failure.

uM2iRsYIpDmJBOPZHjhjaA.text: Amazing food - subpar music selection. If they could stray away from using 2005's top 40 hits that would really elevate things. I will say that they had excellent service - in the words of the supposed manager guy. Chloe was an incredible server and I hope she gets promoted.

XC-R1bVChpCX0XYxbrmeRA.text: Wasn't busy at all, lunch rush was over. Had the the French toast special of the day. Tasted good but not spectacular and my side of hash browns were really oily. lQbtRNGBCrxCkFVKrwfqiA.text: This location is downstairs from my work and the food is excellent.  I had the chicken sandwich and the portions were great with homemade potato chips. LRMr6a0Lb3G_hG8OYUICgg.text: Daniel was our counter waiter. Jason is the general manager. WOW! Great service, Food, and FUN! The picture says it all. We ate everything. Then we rolled to the car. AEJpC8TTWrQWb1NJ7Db9UQ.text: If I could give negative stars I would.   Absolutely the worst lunch experience my two friends and I have ever had.   We all have a rough day at work, but it is all in how you handle the bad situation.  The restaurant  manager was clueless.  Sat for 50 minutes and still no Lunch   Asked them to make it to go. That took another ten minutes.  Took it to go and two of our sandwiches were disappointing at best.  No apology ... just here is your bill.

aqU4EfaMoYRgP1cEQ1Gw6w.text: Great breakfast and delicious drinks. I really enjoyed my meal the other day. Their pancakes are large, fluffy and delicious. Then there's the bacon, ohh that sweet, sweet bacon and the rosemary home fries (for which they painted the recipe on the wall, charming) so good!   I highly recommend stopping by but be prepared to wait as the line can get long esp on weekends.

rFgXwSRHW72hVs4hLBvCVQ.text: Just a forewarning, this place is not bad by any means. It serves good food. Is it remarkable, or memorable? I would say no. If you are looking for a decent meal, at a clean place, with good service, this will suffice. The following review items pin point the food and some things to consider.   I've been here twice: for breakfast and lunch. For breakfast I had the biscuits and gravy, which also came with two eggs and hash browns. For lunch I had the hickory burger with mac salad instead of fries.   The biscuits and gravy was not bad. But be warned. It is not a plate for small stomachs. It's priced at around $11, which seems fair for the food. But in my opinion, biscuits and gravy in and of itself is the meal, and the eggs and browns are overkill. The gravy was a bit too peppery for my taste, the biscuit was near perfect. The egg and hash brown were...egg and hash brown. They have their browns done more on the crispy side, which I also prefer. All in all, I would get it again, but maybe split it with someone else.   The hickory burger was lackluster. The patty was done as I had asked, but a bit dry. The bun was golden and crispy on the outside, but quite dry in the middle. The bun sort dried everything out as you ate, which wasn't pleasant. The BBQ sauce was nice, but the cheese was negligible; and it was shredded. Who puts shredded cheese on a burger?? The sweet onions were diced. Again, who puts diced onions on a burger?? Both travesties. Slice of cheese, and whole onion slices are meant for burgers, it can't be changed. The Mac salad was meh. Dry, and not much flavor other than a step up from just plain pasta. At $17 for the meal, it definitely hurt paying the bill.   The place is clean, the staff are pleasant and quick. No complaints there.   Overall, it's a gamble. But good location, staff, and venue will have me coming back till I find something memorable.

WaykvlytGZvPS-7UZE7n6w.text: Odd experience.    The waitress was hard to find.  Food delivered and coffee refilled by other staff.    Bill time comes.  I drop a $20 plus the exact change.  I'm expecting $6 back.  The aforementioned hard to find waitress brings $5.  Have to flag down the waitress again to tell her change is a dollar short (yes, I know it's not a lot of money but by this time I'm fit to be tied).  Waitress makes some comment about not doing change.  I have no idea what she's talking about but  I know if I go with a follow up question my head will explode.  She leaves and comes back with my dollar (yes, I still know it's not a lot of money).  I have no idea what this whole bill paying ordeal was about, but this quite frankly, is one of the most irritating things to happen in a restaurant in quite some time.  If they have some sort of weird store policy about handling or not handling change, that would be a good data point to tell people about.  As for the food... - Eggs good - Hash browns good - Bacon good, but they really could have done a WAAAAYYYYY better job of getting the grease off the bacon. - Toast good, but I really don't get why MBB does one slice of a thicker cut toast.

-MXNAZIWH4T2wYP2tFyOFg.text: Once you get a table on a busy weekend morning it's delicious. Quality of the food and service are great. We sat at the bar so we got to observe the kitchen and they work really hard. They seem to use every inch of the kitchen space for cooking and garnishing so I do not think there would really be a way to increase their efficiency.   Coffee was delicious and they made sure we had a full cup. Waffles were so yummy. You must try their fruit preserves (I put some on my waffle and it was banging!). Bacon is thick and seasoned to give it an extra kick. Special of the day was great.   Limited menu but the items they do offer are quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yes please

E4hDcQwQT2ITgXVl5Q-qUw.text: Pending an influx of Arizona breakfast venue reviews, I ought to elevate my rating of Matt's Big Breakfast to 5 stars. Allow me to explain:   My previous review, although thorough, factored only situational blemishes in my overall Matt's experience. Given that every Arizonan restaurant I have since visited consistently does not compare to Matt's in terms of quality of food, value, location, and service, I declare Matt's the bar thus set. All others, unless proven otherwise, fare underneath.   In addition, since my previous review, I should give credit to Matt's for getting more creative with their rotating scrambles (I am seeing chorizo less often, so perhaps the surplus has at last worn out). I have also been pleased to have tried the Eggs Benedict (Thursday special) -- an excellent choice to be sure. However, my staple continues to be the cheese omelet with peppers, mushrooms, bacon, and the unbeatable home fries.   If I didn't live within walking distance to the Marina Heights location, I would have probably tried the Phoenix one by now. Soon, soon. Perhaps even the Sky Harbor one if I have an early morning flight to catch.   So, there you have it in the meantime! See you this weekend.

QPtxyLK0icSYDeaSLiwAsQ.text: We went to mats for my birthday. First off let me tell you this, the portion sizes are huge. Two regular people can split a meal and be perfectly fine. In fact, three people might be able to split a meal at mats. The portion sizes are huge.   The orange juice is fabulous. Yes, I'm using the word fabulous because that's how good the ones you see this. I believe it's freshly squeezed orange juice that they make right there but you may want to check with the server to verify.  My lady ordered and on the omelette. I ordered scrambled eggs with the ham off the bone. The ham was good it wasn't as juicy as I wanted but it was still good.  It's a very aesthetic place so if you're into taking photos you'll enjoy it plus the lighting is good.

75xD0pggE-z7aUujVlJ7Dg.text: Matt's Big Breakfast was everything I hoped it would be! The atmosphere was fun and trendy. The food was AMAZING!   We sat at the bar, so we could see all the cooks working their magic in the back. The service was friendly, attentive, and cared about our experience.   I'm already craving the waffles again. Who wants breakfast?

BD-uBKhP10hCaGMz1RdLvQ.text: Came in on a weekday and snagged a seat at the bar. Service was quick and efficient. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and subbed tomatoes for grilled onions + hash browns. The tomato combined with picante sauce were the perfect combo to take this sandwich over the top. The bacon was peppery, thick, and perfectly cooked, roll was buttered and perfectly toasted, and the eggs were fried to perfection. However, may be nice if they have a little run to them  Next time!!! :)

V7OQ9jqssUX4yyUVasClhg.text: I saw Matt's Big Breakfast on social media so before I even arrived in Phoenix I told my friend who lived there that we had to try the breakfast.  I didn't realize there were several locations so she took me to the closest one which was nestled in a nice corporate looking area.  We met other friends and were seated right away. What I learnt about this place is that their eggs are cage free and ingredients are locally sourced from Arizona- a big thumbs up.  I ordered the Special Scramble that Saturday morning and paired it with a mimosa. Our entire table ordered mimosas and were told that the orange juice was freshly squeezed, which I definitely could tell in the taste. It was delicious and I refrained from taking pics because I was busy talking to friends and enjoying the food, that's when you know it's good!  Definitely coming back

UjMt6-FdoGBT5UtZim14Cw.text: We really enjoyed the bacon and eggs, which were perfectly cooked to order. The hash browns tasted like parmesan cheese. Not sure if they have parmesan in them but if they do it should be declared on the menu. The restaurant was a bit dirty though. They'd only been open an hour and weren't busy so you know it was left that way overnight.

sxCVKYghCAGW_18zVTqQ5g.text: Best breakfast ever! We have loved this place for years and it's so hard to find such good food and nice people. Really makes our Saturday mornings special when we go to Matt's!

O8dv07FzihwCF3p2ulBdRw.text: Food: we got the steak and eggs, and cheese omelette, they were very good specially the steak was cooked very well.   Place: always crowded, it's my first time to this branch but i had been to the other branch and both crowded.  Service: we were in the waiting list but we saw many parties who came after us were getting seated, so we went inside to check and didn't find our names in the list even though we saw him right it before. So, we honestly got angry but we were also hungry so we didn't say anything and they seated us immediately. After we finished eating the guy who seated us( NOT the same guy who wrote the name int the list) came to us and gave us a 50% discount on our bill (pic attached) . For that reason i gave them a full 5 starts review.   Price: above average but worth it

nhMC0yT98wERPeiCyWTYcw.text: Omg! I always wanted to try this place because I heard so many good reviews! I'm so glad I did.  My bf ordered the chop and chick. Oh man that pork chop was so delish. The flavor on that chop was amazing. He had it with country potatoes and scrambled eggs. He enjoyed it so much. I had the hog and chick. It came with 3 pieces of thick bacon, hashbrowns, and my over easy eggs. Bacon was different. It isn't the thin slices like any other breakfast places you've been to.. This bacon is nice, tasty, thick, soft as you chew it, and crunchy on the ends. It wasn't't salty neither which was perfect.  I also had 2 of their mimosas! Mmmm so good. I love this place. Awesome service too! Well the bartender was because we sat at the bar to eat since it was super packed. The other chick, I forgot her name but when I asked for ketchup she kind of gave me an attitude. Good thing the food and bartender made up for it.   But hands down! This is the best breakfast place in my opinion in AZ!!
