Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. The hog and chick

EJPBbFqvSQ9zle1ttIS7Wg.text: Small menu but the food is decent. My biggest issue is they don't have a kids menu, so you can expect to pay an extra $12-15 per kid (which adds up fast!!) and wasting a ton of food. We probably won't be back.

18PCu4hr40706JmSHiPnXQ.text: We always thought Matt's Big Breakfast was mediocre, but we decided to give it another chance at this location (that we've never been to before) - our fault!  If you like anything listed below, come here!  * Disarray. Playing musical chairs on where to be seated; or Goldilocks trial and error; or third time's a charm--literally--to be seated...  * Dirty Tables. Saw a couple servers just standing around chit chatting.  * Dirty mugs. Big bright red lipstick stain that's easy to see unless your head is someplace else)--the server blamed the lipstick being probably one of the 24 hr. ones. Mind you, I used to be a server and I always checked the plates and silverware beforehand.  * Rubbery, extremely oily eggs and veggies. Less than mediocre than what I remembered it to be.  * Half-undercooked, half-burnt potatoes/home-fries  * Listening to the chef yell he needs a plate and that someone needs to "hurry". If you read some of the yelp reviews (which we should've done beforehand) they include burnt burgers or potatoes--now I know why...  * Not receiving our waffle to share. The server blamed the guy who was serving the food, but later realized it was her fault because she never put it in.  Didn't think it was worth waiting for it, especially since it was such a task for our server to attend to us. We had to flag her down to get us utensils, napkins, fill our waters and coffee... It almost seemed she tried to avoid us, maybe because of embarrassment of our unpleasant experience from the get-go.  * Being overcharged $1 more (but wanted to get out ASAP so we didn't think it worth to change)  * Paying for it all as if it was at a 5-star restaurant...ok maybe exaggerating, but I expect to at least get decent food if they're gonna charge the way they do...  I'm not one to write a bad review, unless it absolutely bothers me. When you pay for a service or an experience, you at least expect it to not leave you with such exasperation.  We definitely won't be coming back.

SIzfyrPxNIZjT0MRFaQ20Q.text: We got here at brunch time to be told it was a 20 min wait. 50 minutes later...  there is no sense of urgency to turn the tables. They would sit dirty for at least 5 mins.  The waiter was awesome. Helped us choose food to meet our hunger.  Portions were so big I could only eat half. Come with an appetite. We had eggs, hash browns, bacon, toast and a burger between the 3 of us. The salami and eggs was fabby!!  The burger was juicccyyy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Eggs, bacon &amp; hash brows with sourdough toast.

X3V3DpooZidsq11Y7-23Qg.text: I went here for breakfast and it was average at best.  I have never seen a good place where you could not get avocado on an omelet.  I ordered an egg white omelet and that forgot to do it as egg white. They did remake quickly but tasted average at best.  Also traffic into the area is just terrible.  I'm sure good location if you are working in the complex.

gD8bUBI_8BiJ7g9BcIDs6Q.text: Definition of a good ol' American breakfast! They have a small manageable menu. Missing some things you usually see at other places. The bacon and sausage links are a must. I went before closing time so their service was fast. Reasonable price for such a BIG dish I'll be back to try another dish

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hog and chick

ZVOzst95FYxKR728eWWBmA.text: I love this Place, but my last visit we a  bit unsatisfying, just with the kitchen side. I came on a Saturday and got seated in about 10 minutes!! That's was amazing! The staff was great and friendly! My mom got a glass of water, and it stunk. It smelled like eggs and that shoed that it wasn't washed well. We told our waitress  about it and she quickly fixed fixed that issue. Then the food was great! But my mom wasn't able to finish her food so she ordered a box for her omelette. She went to put her food in the box and under the omelette there was hair!! Needless to say if we knew that she wouldn't have ate it. My biggest issue was how I believe the manager reacted. He was nice but asked if the hair was there before we ate the food, he kind of nudged at the fact that we were lying but we weren't.  I love the place and I hope this is a solo occurrence.

aRU63kt76Bo-a6iyw_5agw.text: Matt's Big Breakfast definitely makes big pancakes. Not only big, but fluffy. They had lots of buttermilk flavor. I would not hesitate to order them again.   My husband ordered the greens and beans bowl with chicken.  It also came with a poached eggs. He found it to be a little lacking in flavor. That being said, he appreciated the healthier option.   Toast is served as two thick cut slices. It is also served with house made jam. Different jams are served with different types of toast. Sourdough is served with blackberry jam. The jam was jam packed with fruit. If I would have known, I would have ordered a side of jam to go with my pancakes. It seriously looked like a fruit compote.  Server seemed confused. I am not sure if it was because we were a big group, or they just were.   Something to note, menu is on the small side. There also are no children's options. There are ala carte options. We created a smaller meal for our youngest with that.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Stack of pancakes
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beans and greens bowl with chicken
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kitchen

9SQtPc0ysfI789akOvNyPQ.text: A cool little spot off Tempe Town Lake. They have a small menu but it doesn't feel incomplete. The pancakes are amazing, they have daily specials, and the coffee is roasted locally! We sat at the breakfast bar and service was quick and attentive, you can tell the employees are passionate about the food. A great place if you're looking for a tasty breakfast

GOEymu5lzALWTfPInl_xpA.text: The food was pretty good. They make their own jelly/jam, so that was pretty fun! Very busy, so it is hard to get in sometimes.

Yb0evYh-a3JMg_BrHjP7CQ.text: I have given matt's a few tries since it's located where I work and everything I have gotten there is just too greasy. There is better breakfast out there.

6WnGT9Wk4sjih0wqNqsJwA.text: A shining beacon of mediocrity.  Pros - it is a restaurant.  They serve food.  That food is okay.  Cons - despite ample room, the outdoor seating was closed because (I shit you not) hostile pigeons had overrun the courtyard.  Also, the drinks were over priced and watered down.  Finally, service was by and large quite slow.  It wasnt bad, but nothing stood out.  It simply was.

cDDptjBuxO0XuohOXJ9Dew.text: FIRST!!! The staff was AH-MAAAAA-ZING! Very very nice and polite. Wonderful.   The two stars is because this place is OFFENSIVELY overpriced. I actually left without ordering due to its absurd pricing. LIke Ritz Carlton room service pricing. (Ive ordered room service from the Ritz, I know what that costs) To feed my two little kids and myself breakfast would have been about $50 with tip.     Three pancakes. $7.95  Yes. You read that right. I'm not sure if they have retired US Presidents making them but $8 for three pancakes that cost 3 cents to make seems a bit steep.  Glass of OJ= $4.95  Made from oranges. NOT made from oranges harvested by Angels mind you.  Soda, one brand in a can. NO refills. $2.00 (RC Cola. I didn't even know that they were still in business. Who drinks that crap?) I could go on...  No kids menu. Annoying. NO regualr fountain drinks. Annoying. Absurd pricing. Annoying. Amazing staff. WONDERFUL!  So I think Im going to open a food truck right outside and call it "Matt's Third cousins Big and realistically priced Breakfast. Whos with me?

Unq6hmS7keCsyk52h9Pvgw.text: If you are ever in Tempe, Arizona just outside of Phoenix, then go to Matt's Big Breakfast for food that will not disappoint:)  Located in Marina Heights near the State Farm building, this famous Arizona breakfast branch is nice and clean, and ready to take your order.  I ordered the pork chop with 2 overhard eggs, home fries with rosemary, and wheat toast with a side of berry jam.  The bottomless coffee was very good especially with the small tin of milk versus creamer provided.  The rosemary was prevalent in the pork chop that was perfectly cooked and succulent in taste.  Speaking of succulent, there was also a succulent as a table decoration that added a touch of Arizona.  The highlight was the addition of thick cut bacon I ordered to compliment my meal, which were 3 apple smoked and peppered pieces that were so crispy and flavorful, I wanted to hug Matt and thankfully say "now this is how bacon should taste!"  This organic farm to table type establishment was an excellent representation of what a modern breakfast in Arizona should taste like and worth eating on a placeMatt;)

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States

4RzCJxi8QD1f8PIRbRBSJw.text: All yummy food! Make sure you go to Downtown location. Tempe location is not as good as the original. Will definitely be back

h0vEnjVJDrZro1nJAgzchw.text: This Matt's Big Breakfast is located in the new Marina Heights campus. Parking is easy, and they make sure to validate you ticket. There is usually no wait, but it does get super busy during lunch time.  The menu is limited but very delicious. I got the Waffle with bacon, and I could not leave a bite behind. Also, you get your food very quickly, so you are usually in and out.  I will definitely go again, plus I like the location more than the downtown location.

tX2WaH8sOcvVPd-oc_I5Pw.text: Try their greasy rancid breakfast ceiling tiles that supposedly once was potatoes... You'll never come back... Your welcome

Nj2OturcwEswXQocvQldQQ.text: Matt's is in a league all it's own! Accidently stumbled upon it today when going to the new Mountainside Fitness located in the StateFarm Mega Campus surrounding Tempe Town Lake. Considering my wife and I are absolute foodies to the core, we both dropped the ball on this place! As in how have we not heard of and already made this gem a regular in our good eats rotation!   Now for the food!   Me: The Five Spot, 2 eggs real butter cage free, 2 ridiculously thick pieces of suculant bacon, Wisconsin cheddar on a hand made roll! This thing was 5 bucks... Get real! I'd show you if I didnt eat it too fast!.  Wife: Cheese Ommlett: honestly we didnt speak the entire meal nor have time to look at each other's plates; too concentrated and focused on each and ever bite! So, it was spectacular or my wife would have been chatting away as usual!   Please if for no other reason you come here though, at least venture in to have a glass of the no lie 100% winner of a prize I will only give out once in this lifetime...... World's Best Lemonade Period... Ok so this award won't be featured in the NY Times, and I don't have a plaque or ribbon, however you do have permission to add this prestigious title to your official menu! Who knew honey was the missing ingrediant in each amnd every lemonade recipe world wide! #SaveTheBees  Concluding this essay I've typed up for you other locals, and or tourist/ASU parents, let's recap your options: IHop, Chompies, U.S Egg, Sooze. Let me solve the dilema of having options, and point you to the lakeside eatery I've been to only once and know where all future breakfast\brunch\lunch dollars will go if we are eating out!   PS stellar service, every single staff member was vigiliant, respectful, and happy. Had a Trader Joe staff kind of feel if you know what I mean!

lccYhQELaOXX4BpyjYuP0A.text: Coffee cup was dirty, the replacement cup was dirty too. Both times they served it. Do they not look at the cups before serving it?And do they not wash dishes?

WRG_lDS_URb9JBMbKt7-kw.text: Best breakfast we've ever had omg! Melt in your mouth.   Hidden on the backside of a bland business center, but the ambience of the actual restaurant was nice and inviting.   Kind staff.   I would have paid double for what we received, and I would eat here 1,000 more times if we ever return to the area (we are from Oregon).  Cheers!!

CVav_SaHUKI_efDxhO6OYg.text: Good food and nice staff. Must visit. Not a huge menu, but a good mix of all types of popular breakfast choices. Parking lot is a bit tricky. Coffee is excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak special
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Omelette with hash fries
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Waffle and sausage patties

zf7Crl4c4aLBZ6HTCt5jQg.text: We were visiting Tempe and decided to stop by because we saw the place in a TV show.  The place is a bit hidden but very cool, staff was extremely attentive and nice. The best of all was The Classic Reuben, Just amazing combinations of flavors that I absolutely loved! Their waffles look very good too but I just had no room to try it... The rash browns are made in a very particular way, I also loved it!  I recommend this place!

p4wRVEGZG0pC-Z-AL130dg.text: My egg sandwich was very delicious but they messed up the take out order. I ordered a side of bacon and 1 egg sandwich but instead they gave me 2 egg sandwiches and charged me for both with no side of bacon. I didn't notice their blunder until my friend brought the order home to me. I was pretty upset about their mistake as it cost me alot of extra $.

UbDLrgwEpC-PzinxdUYRcw.text: Used to be a alright place when they opened but they had a horrible dip in quality recently and so now I will try to avoid this place.  I ordered a Cobb salad like i usually do and its typically decked out with olives, 1 to 2 eggs sliced in, blue cheese scattered through out, a big piece grilled chicken laying on top, dressing, lot of their bacon chopped in and freshly sliced tomatoes.  Well I think they have switched to more of a fast food format because when I went there for lunch like usual and ordered it again, I was baffled and thought at first I got the wrong order so I went back and returned it because it just looked like plain piled on lettuce with dressing mixed in, the person working at the front noticed too and said it may have been due to a new employee so had it redone. So I brought to try and eat it again as he assured me that he saw it get made this time and it was done correctly.  And it wasnt, it was disgusting. The chicken was diced and kinda tasted like cold packaged white chicken that was just poured at the bottom, and not much of it at that maybe like 2 fork fulls if I were to attempt to stab every little squared diced piece.  The tomatoes were now also diced and again like 2 fork fulls worth tasted like they were again just bought pre done at a grocery store although there was so little mixed in it was hard to tell. No olives. A single chunk of cheese not spread throughout probably about the size of a quarter. Half of an egg sliced into 3 sections sitting on top of the salad. 2 Teaspoons of crumbled bacon. And a whole lot of romaine lettuce. And 2 packages of dressing on the side.  Like what the heck happened o.o how does a place go downhill that fast. I could understand a cheap $2 premade side salad being like that but not a main menu item that im paying $11 for on a salad. I didnt go back to return it a 2nd time as apparently this is just the quality of the food they serve now and the guy that works the register at the front is just always so nice that itd be kinda weird to cause a stink over this again as I know it wasnt his fault its prepared like that now. Oh well. :/

H3ZWQn56DrqUL8qVVY457w.text: How I'd have loved to see a Tofu Scramble or a Vegan Pancake option on the menu for the fellow vegans and vegetarians? Sadly, I had to make by with the oatmeal. My husband had the toast and home fries. The blueberry spread was good. Neat location, inside Marina Heights. 4 stars for the great service.

gvnfRKV-rF2ZQRQTR6bbcQ.text: The food is awesome. The service is too notch and the prices are reasonable. If you are looking for a breakfast spot, this is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Saturday Special! Amazing

n838VDVscza7oOdxn_1Ztg.text: I have been to the Matt's Big Breakfast at the airport once before but this place has really stepped up their game! The management was on point, making sure we were happy and got our food promptly. I had a custom-made omelet and was not disappointed. Everything from the peppers, eggs, bacon and coffee grounds are all locally sourced and as fresh as it gets. The icing on the cake for me was the bacon, one of the thickest cuts I've ever received at a restaurant and the flavor was out of this world. Highly recommend trying this place out, no doubt you'll be a returning customer!

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Matt&#39;s Big Breakfast at Marina Heights building 2

tohDvTvrRxR0mwgL6C-bMQ.text: It was a nice surprise to know Matt's Big Breakfast opened a new location a little closer to home. The new location is beautiful and has a nice wide open view of the kitchen. We sat at the bar area and had great interactions with the staff. Of course, the food was amazing and was fairly inexpensive. I highly recommend the Sunday Steak & Eggs special if you get the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak &amp; Eggs Sunday Special

osmTZ-A_zId1eCoN5PhWZA.text: The staff was very pleasant and friendly. I ordered the Special which was 3 eggs "scrambled " with jalapeno sausage and cheese with a dude of homestyle potatoes. The eggs were still runny and sausages didn't even seem to be cooked all the way.  The potatoes were still hard... Its likely I won't order from there again.... what a waste of $16...  I work in the building next store and would rather drive somewhere else than eat that food again.

zCE20IgyRJnUhs3fIGeRsA.text: I LOVE this place! Delicious food at a great price! You will NOT ever regret eating here and you'll never leave hungry! The staff is amazing and super friendly! They always go above and beyond to ensure you enjoy your time there! Even if you call ahead and order to-go! That's a wonderful option, by the way! Try it! You'll love it, too!

-VBh6ZkYLe3zU2r_TpT7DA.text: After hearing how great Matt's Big Breakfast was, some friends and I decided to give it a try.  Boy, was I not impressed.  The menu is VERY limited and disappointing.  I wasnt too impressed with the food at all.  I ended up ordering a waffle.  It came with bacon, which was so burnt I didnt eat it.  The waffle was "ok", nothing to write home about.  My dining partners had a reuben sandwich and a chicken sandwich, both of which they said were good.  The ONLY redeeming quality about our visit was the staff--everyone was very friendly and offered a smile.  I still havent figured what is so BIG about Matt's Breakfast, and after our visit, I dont intend on finding out.

US9vNbKFFJrBkByIkQRwUA.text: Stay away from the Cobb Salad. Mine was soggy as if the ingredients had all been mixed together and then everything was refrigerated. The dressing doesn't compliment the salad very well either.

wpzoRbB3zagJttx7oLdZ6Q.text: I work at the State Farm building that is connected to this Matt's Big Breakfast and wow I am very impressed! The food is amazing always! And the staff is so friendly.. I am greeted with a friendly hello every time I walk through the door by either Daniel, Asia, or the manager Jason. Jason is always helpful if I ever have questions about the menu and Asia does a great job explaining the specials for the day. If I get a to-go order Daniel is always a big help! Excellent location! I keep going back!

0uc7lSbc2E2mNwZjiaZjAw.text: Highly recommend!  Got the Tuesday's special biscuit and gravy with fresh blackberry lemonade!  My servers name was Daniel he was fast, kind and very knowledgeable. Overall a great experience!  If your from Arizona or just passing by I would make sure to put it on your list!

kUjevVeuVfKOZfNdSoLAfQ.text: This place is so bomb. It was Sunday so tried the steak and eggs special. Loved how the potatoes came with caramelized onions and rosemary. Eggs were cooked right and steak was good. Added a side of pancakes and was delicious. Definitely recommend this place to anyone.

K6lmuJe1PrOhSlIPcgD3Rg.text: Great service and great food. The seasoned bacon is to die for! Portions are very large and filling.  Minus 1 star due to Mimosas being $8 and very small (could barely taste champagne), and when I asked for a toast substitute the only thing they could offer was 2 slices of tomato, that's it. (Most restaurants would offer fruit or cottage cheese).  Will definitely be back!

bJVTE16cFB5y8Nf9h_xMLQ.text: I have been here before and felt very welcomed. But today. It's a beautiful day out side. And we wanted to sit on the patio. We were made to feel it was a inconvenience. Then the food showed up on a dirty plate. Service really needs help.

zqsk0zpdPB5tyZdSpXZFpw.text: The waitress was very rushed. She didn't wait until I was done ordering before asking others at my table for their orders. I enjoyed my scramble and hash browns, but was disappointed when the description of my plate included toast but "it actually doesn't come with toast." I had to order an extra side of it, and when it came, it was just two plain slices of bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. I just wanted to say that the Friday Special Scramble DOES NOT come with toast w/ housemade preserves. It&#39;s a very misleading description.

eK0sWuTQ5X2OcXuP6DCsNg.text: Daniel the waiter is personable, professional, and genuine. The other servers and service less than fair/ok. 8 minute wait to be acknowledged, 15 minutes for meal was understandable as I asked for well done bacon. Manager on duty looked like he just rolled out of bed (untucked shirt and beach shoes).  My bearded waiter was more concerned with counting the cash in his pocket wallet than seeming customers as more than a potential tip. Check boxes for service checked off but interactions were not genuine.

aiW1jTJh2m-AkvM71bLa2A.text: Matt's food quality is exceptional as a customer I am always provided with an awesome customer experience.  If you like a old school diner vibe with an urban twist, Matt's is the place to dine-in if you want to meet with colleagues for lunch, etc....its ideal. Daniel who works there is absolutely remarkable.

XqMGM73xL27rRZWMBX9cmA.text: Waited almost 20 minutes for my breakfast order, which is why I'm giving just 3 stars. But once it came, my food was good. The verde sauce on the huevos rancheros was delicious. I probably won't do the potatoes again because they are heavily seasoned with rosemary which I personally don't care for.  But they were roasted to perfection, with onion. So if you like rosemary, these will make you very happy!

N2X7DoWhBclO9WJV5Xhd-w.text: This is now my #1 breakfast spot in AZ! So delish and my waitress, Janiel, was awesome. She made recommendations and was spot on with her description. The pork chop was juicy and not over salted. I got pepper jack cheese on my hash browns which were actually brown. I am going to frequent this place. Great food, great service, and great vibe. Staff was laughing and joking around which tells me they have fun while working there! Thanks for a great experience Matt's Big Breakfast of Tempe. Keep it up peeps. Highly recommended you visit THIS location!!!

Zs-EyLZGyoaAEvv2Ujmk9Q.text: Been here three times, really like the food, want to give a good review, but the service is spotty at best, over medium eggs come out Sunnyside up, bill was someone else's, I'm honest so I told them:( quality good, be prepared for only fair service...

63e7YSvpdxZs7nJUQJsXoA.text: This place was amazing. I've worked in the food Industry for 20 years, I'm not sure I've experienced a more friendly staff. I was in Phoenix for spring training with a large group of friends and our kids. We were going to an afternoon game and wanted to take the kids to breakfast first. We had heard good things about Matt's big breakfast so decided to check it out. The staff was extremely accommodating, offering plenty of different options for a group our size. In the end we decided the best option would be to split up into separate tables. The moment I sat down, we were greeted by a friendly server who immediately brought us a waffle. I explained that I didn't order one, to which she replied with a smile "I know". We had been having a rough morning after driving for 12 hours straight so this was exactly what I needed. Within another minute, the manager came by and asked if we would like chocolate milks for the kids. We ordered an omelette, griddle cakes, breakfast potatoes, and waffles. Everything was amazing. The omelette was made in the traditional style with the eggs cooked so perfectly that there was no brown, the filling were in the middle then dried out and cooked into the eggs. The potatoes were cooked perfectly crispy and tender at the same time. The waffle came with a side of delicious house made strawberry preserves. Thank you to Matt's big breakfast for starting off our trip on an amazing note!

N7zQz82l9Mr7Pk2Y2u8AWg.text: I've tried all of Matt's locations and this by far has the best views, seating and overall size (less wait times). The food was the standard Matt's, which is great. The five spot with their special bacon is great. They have great rosemary potatoes. Unfortunately this visit to the Tempe location was not up to par based on the service. Hardly had the waitress come by the table. I asked for water but it never was delivered and had a funky tasting glass of ice tea that I wanted to trade out because there tea is good but this must have been mixed with something or brewed too long. Good breakfast just low on the service scale today.

UzbyYIUy9FZW5Kkwdbd6Jw.text: Nice location and you can park in the garage for two hours without a charge. However, Saturday morning breakfast was totally chaotic even though there weren't that many people in the restaurant. Obviously the kinks need to be worked out. Food was OK... Not what it is at other locations of Matt's. I'll give it another try in a few months.

A1RxSYcc1hkXgqmFSm0Y1A.text: Well, I have heard such good things about this place and well...it didn't live up to the hype!  The poached eggs swimming in water and the mini sausages had no flavor, and the hashbrowns were just gooey inside! But the bread and jams were a treat and the attention that we got from OTHER servers and management was impressive!  But I will not suggest going nor would I visit again!

pO2Zzjy4leNPby5-vFH7KQ.text: i have been going to the OG Matt's in Phoenix for years and this new location did not disappoint. attentive service, bright and open interior and food absolutely on par with the quality i have always enjoyed from Matt, Ernie and crew. grateful for a location close to home!

slW-j03_FlFBQ5hkJOKvMA.text: Meh.   I was excited to try this place because my friend loved it last time she came but it wasn't worth it to me. For $60 on brunch I'd expect better service to be honest.  The place wasn't busy at all and our sever never checked on us. We're halfway through meal and champagne glasses are bone dry and our server brings us our bill stating no rush... to me when I'm still eating and the bill is brought that is rushing me out. We were there around 130 which they still had an hour to close so idk why we were being pushed out so fast. We asked for another drink and our server acted like he didn't wanna work anymore. We said thank you and he's like mhm, crumples the bill he originally brought to add extra drink and walks away. I'm sorry, but adding more drinks to bill raises the bill which means more tip.   The food was pretty good. I had the skinny eggs and it was a good portion for the price. I'm all about service though and this place fell short of that. The manager was checking on table but never came to us. The manager came to our table to take my card to pay, and I said oh it's already paid I need to just sign and he drops card and walks off.. doesn't say anything. Kind of odd  I live in north Phoenix and drove to Tempe cause my friend said it was worth it but I don't think so. The service was meh and the food was alright. Not worth the drive tho so this will be the place that I skip next time.

VNRzIHPOWsdtoMNbpW6BPQ.text: Matt's Big Breakfast wasn't bad but also wasn't great. The breakfast menu didn't have many options. I ended up getting the five spot breakfast sandwich and my girlfriend got a omelet with veggies since there weren't any vegan options. Overall the food was good, simple, and inexpensive. It is more of a casual atmosphere so expect it to be a bit loud and quite busy at times. If you're looking for a simple and inexpensive breakfast this might be your spot.

zfXjVZAjGW2V8diPbebn_A.text: My previous experience was very pleasant but today I changed my mind. I sat at the bar solo, one waiter takes my drink order then disappears. Another waitress takes my food order then disappears. A different waitress comes to me and asks how the food was. That's messed up. Who should I tip? And besides that, their attitudes (all of them) are careless and distracted. I didn't even dare to approach the issue that my pork chop steak was tough and insipid. Not only the steak but also the scramble eggs were flavorless, hash browns so oily... I truly exclusively enjoyed the sourdough bread with the handmade jelly and the orange juice. That's why I give 2 stars instead of 1. I read the story on the back of the menu of how proud the owner is to feature quality of food and organic, local-grown products and bla bla bla. But where's the quality? I'm a foodie, I want to eat well. What you gave me this morning was very ordinary, at best. There's a lot of competition in this town due to the fact that there are so many breakfast places. You must give your customers something that will make them come back to you. Otherwise, from now on, big red cross on Matt's Big Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Daily specials

GWTuc00dDY7hzLNmicUHyg.text: I was treated to a great breakfast for my birthday.  We ordered waffle and bacon and steak and eggs. I had the delicious waffle.  I did try the steak and it was very tender and tasty.  They also have a cold coffee it's called nitron but didn't get to try but it's equivalent to a cold brew. This is a great cheat meal or if you just want a great treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Matt's Big Breakfast - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs  And waffles and bacon

pIYeugegRavdRcoPQyDmjQ.text: Amazing food, as advertised. Thick cut black pepper bacon was some of the best bacon I've ever had. Busy place with a bit of a wait, but worth it. Going to the Camelback location next.

TU5aG9A1QlOXZJnMt6c2zg.text: First timer here. Came around 12:00PM to avoid the anticipated lines.  There were no lines :)  Ordered the Waffle, which was delicious. It was Belgian style but also had fluff to it. Ordered toast and their homemade preserves and that was excellent as well. Probably one of the best waffles I've had in some times. The waffle also came with bacon, which was thick cut and tasted excellent. I'll be back!  5 stars for customer service 4 stars for their food quality  5 stars for their restaurant cleanliness 3 stars for their location (parking building)

WN_yR9v4EzIotJ4_bsIQGw.text: I love a good breakfast place on the weekend but...I don't like to drive (and sometimes I don't have time to catch the light rail from Tempe to Downtown) so though I love Matt's Big Breakfast, my culinary dalliances with this well known establishment were sadly, few and far between.  However, to use a cliche, as Mohammad did not want to take the time to get to the mountain, the mountain has come to Mohammad with an extension of this chain right near ASU in the buildup of State Farm and many other places along Rio Salado. As such, I set up a breakfast date with friends, put on my hoodie (it's chilly early on a January morning folks) and peddled over to this location, and it lovely!  Nestled amid a delightful little corporate park, with plenty of space for tables and a long breakfast bar, it is hard to imagine the original and tiny location that is now just a storage space.  One side of the restaurant has glass doors through which one can see the outer area (which is lovely) and of course, when the weather is warmer, they can be opened up for outside seating. As for the food, just as good as the other location(s) with a focus on simply prepared but delicious food. I had the waffle with two strips of bacon for about $9 and added two scrambled eggs for another $3. I also had a cup of their wonderfully strong Joe so make sure to ask for cream if you want to take the edge off.   As it is near the college I'm sure you can get breakfast all day so if your Saturday or Sunday starts when others eat lunch, you are still good. The one thing I don't think they have is any adult beverages, which is not uncommon at many establishments in the Tempe area so something to be aware of if that is a consideration on your part.  Oh, if you don't want to ride your bike there is free parking by the restaurant so you don't necessarily have to park in the parking garage (and I don't know if that requires payment or is free, like I said, I tend to ride my bike in this area). So, go check out their newest location.  I don't think you will be dissappointed.:-)

The servings were gigantic. My niece had an awesome salad but again it was huge.   The place was a little difficult to find. You actually are turning into an office park. pVX3Gr4Rkqlh9OIUnCqhuw.text: This place is seriously on point.  My wife and I are here with some friends for spring training.  We were told to come here for breakfast and it was probably the best breakfast I've ever had.  The location is great, food is awesome and great customer service.  Blake was our server and he was on top of everything.  He took our order promptly and was quick worth he drinks.  I had about 5-6 iced teas and never had to wait.  Then the food came.  Omg! Amazing. EXJerWQGIlwrUO-UrYGi4w.text: We had just landed in Phoenix for Spring Break/ Spring Training. My husband had heard about Matt's Big Breakfast on one of his podcasts that he listens to so I thought we'd try it.  Saturday late morning....PLEASE be prepared to WAIT. It was a little over an hour for a group of 6. Altho the empty tables sat dirty for a while - so maybe they were short on bussers. The wait wasn't too bad because you can walk along the lake, sit in the grass and enjoy the architecture of the State Farm campus.   We were seated inside, and our waitress was super cool. I have to forewarn you; the actual menu itself is pretty limited. 10 items max for breakfast and maybe 6-7 sandwhich/lunch items. Their ice tea was delish. I ordered the special that was a "chicken enchilada sausage" scramble with jalapenos. Yum! But even better than that were their breakfast potatoes. YUM! My husband ordered a side of bacon, but by the time I was ready to try it - he had eaten it all! HAHA!   I love the area, and the food was yum, so I would probably come back!

P7dAToKKYE3k1XbThyyLtw.text: Well my sister and I decided to try Matt's in Tempe today and the food was good but the service well inadequate at best.  Our girl server came and took our order I had a few  questions (dietary needs and all) I ended up ordering the BLT since it was breakfast I requested the breakfast potatoes instead of chips and coffee. Well my food came with chipsI let the server (not the waitress) know I didn't order chips but the potatoes she immediate brought a side of the potatoes (great service) and I ordered sourdough but got wheat bread no biggie. We continued to eat and my coffee was running low waitress no where to be found however the server was close by "don't know where our waitress is but can I get some more coffee please" she immediately brought more coffee, great service!  We continued to eat our meal and talk and yet again I had to ask another person for more coffee since our waitress was no where to be found.  We where done with our meal and sat there waiting for our illusive waitress, we had to ask the very attentive waiter (very nice young man who knew his regulars) again "we don't know where are waitress is but can we get a couple togo boxes and our check" really!!!  I am a very good tipper I always give more than 20% however this time I did not tip a cent food was great just make sure you sit at the table where the young man will wait on you.

RYAkLTK4cXFke7NGdneeWw.text: Matt's has great food and service. We felt warmly welcomed and our server took time to patiently answer our many question. The food is very, very good, and actually healthy. They use many local organic ingredients and you can taste the difference. Our litmus test at every breakfast or lunch restaurant, to see if they really care, is to check the ketchup bottle to see if it lists high fructose corn syrup as an ingredient. The logic is that natural sugar ketchup costs more, and restaurants who serve it up really care about our health and theirs, down to the smallest detail. Matt's passed the test! The food is ample and delicious, and you will leave very satisfied.

yTGX_C-o1iHXc1hpDF591A.text: Fathers Day breakfast at our favorite breakfast spot.  Food is exceptional here, staff was spot on and they are very consistent in the kitchen.   Wish they'd open up their patio more.  This morning would have been perfect outside!

The location is in a beautiful facility. I would definitely go again. No wait not a lot of people. I'm sure it's different on the weekends. The prices are also reasonable.

ECLpWb8wg0K_uo33mQbPhA.text: I came here with a few friends visiting from out of town. I have been to the one in Arcadia-Biltmore area and thought this one in Tempe would be a great experience like the one I've had. Well, this was not the case, to say the least. We get there, but since we're one person short (3/4), the manager asks us to wait for a table, even though there are multiple available for 4 people (I mean, there are no tables of three as far as I'm concerned. 3 people take up a table of 4). After a 20-25 minute wait (15 min after the 4th person got there, mind you), we get a table, and one of my friends ordered the Bloody Mary. He said it was awful; I couldn't believe him until I tried it myself. Awful cannot describe how bad this drink was, and I have had Bloody Mary's before. We end up ordering food and after a rather long wait (granted, they were a bit busy), we get it. Literally half of our orders are missing: no coffee, no toast, no preserves. We had to tell a waiter and our waitress on separate occasions to get it to us. This is a polar opposite of MBB in Arcadia; the manager in Tempe better get his act together and take some notes from the other one. Or just go to the one in Arcadia if you want some good MBB.

f2rRfPR9MsSe5jERLUGTvg.text: It's so great that I don't have to go to the downtown location while here on business. Been coming to Matt's for years. This newish Tempe location is great. Large. Bright and neat ASU. Staff was super friendly too. I'm pretty simple when it comes to breakfast so I opted for the two egg breakfast with their incredible bacon. What's even more enjoyable is their thick sliced sourdough toast. The hash browns are also delicious. But let me get back to the bacon. Thick cut. Peppered. Perfectly cooked crisp with an outstanding smoky flavor. And while you may be tempted to get Starbucks across the way, their coffee is also flavorful. I'm pretty sure I'm gonna need a nap after this in this hot weather but it's worth it. Vince was a great guy too. Breakfast is also served all day. Parking in the Marina Center. Free wifi. Just happy that there wasn't a wait!

The last 4 times I've come in they have completely ruined my order or left something off because the idiot's cooking clearly can't read.  I've complained, I've asked the servers to double check before bringing it out and still nothing. I have a severe allergy and they just brush it off like it's nothing.  What an absolute cluster. VG5GZYcJFj3YpcXz9TbJzA.text: If you take nothing else from my review of Matt's, hear this.  GET THE OFF-THE-BONE HAM!  Get it.    I love this place, it is my go to breakfast spot.  I've taken family and I've taken friends and the reviews are always A+  I am a basic breakfast guy.  I like cured meats, over easy eggs, potatoes and toast.  The hog and chick breakfast does each of the above elements as well as I can imagine.  If I lived closer I would be here twice a week.  Do yourself a favor and go!

IGW47EB2k9W_VeZJRQ11Pw.text: When I recently visited the Arizona area I had heard this restaurant mentioned repeatedly. So l tried the restaurant for breakfast one day to see for myself how great the food was. As soon as I entered the restaurant I was greeted immediately and told that I could sit anywhere which was great. Soon after I picked a table I was approached by a friendly waiter with a menu. Looking over the menu I initially wanted to try the pancakes but the menu offers them alone so I chose the waffle which included bacon on the side. However, I asked if I could substitute the bacon for the apple smoked sausage that was offered with their French toast special. If you want eggs you will have to order them separately which I found a little annoying.  Once the food was served the presentation was great but I must admit I expected more in the taste area. For one when I tried the waffle the taste of flour was very overwhelming to me. I have definitely had better tasting waffles. The sausage that I was charged a extra $4.00 for tasted like a smoked kielbasa type sausage instead of the breakfast style I expected. I also ordered eggs and asked that they not be cooked to hard but they were.     Maybe my expectations were to high from all of the hype I heard but I wasn't very impressed with the food especially at the prices that they charged.

My grandson, granddaughter plus daughter-in-law also loved their pancakes, waffle and cheese omelet. BMYzrIHb4Qa6JK5jpRaWow.text: A better name would be "Matt's BAD Breakfast". Service is horrifyingly bad.  The food isn't much better. After waiting 45 minutes to be seated and then sitting on uncomfortable barstools for 30 more minutes we found out our order mysteriously didn't get placed correctly and had to be submitted again. Then when it finally arrived the "overhard" eggs were runny and cold, the hash browns were partially burnt, yet raw in the middle. Our server offered no apologies - only excuses. The server never asked us if we wanted beverage refills (we did), nor were we provided with an order update-  even after it was obvious someone screwed up because customers seated 30 minutes after us had ordered and left before our food appeared.  Don't go unless you want overpriced Bloody Mary's, which are admittedly the only consistently good thing on the menu.

The home fries were stratospheric and they are a must! I had eggs with tortillas and beans with Chile sauce.  Chi chi! Arrival! Que bueno. My son, Ned, had the waffle which he loved. My wife had the bacon and eggs with home fries of course and loved it. The coffee was good! Everything was great.

3YTw-z3uUoZNA-N7mrx2KA.text: I decided to take a nice long bike ride along Tempe Town Lake. I needed some refueling and remembered that this place is along the route.  The menu here is somewhat limited providing maybe 8-10 options for breakfast. I seem to be a creature of habit, so again, I order the skinny breakfast consisting of 4 egg whites with apple sausage, tomatoes, cheese (I request easy) and a salad with vinegarette on the side. Very fresh and yummy.  I also got a hot coffee with almond milk as a substitute for cream. By the way, the coffee here is a locally roasted brew and it is rich and Delish!!!  As for the service?.....always very accommodating, friendly and fast. Our server was more than willing to make sure our experience was above and beyond.  The atmosphere is clean and modern. They also offer outdoor seating with a nice view with ample seating.   I recommend this place especially if you're out and about exploring the lake or taking in an event at the ASU stadium across the street.

Unfortunately the eggs benedict and special kinds of scrambles are only made once a week!  Even their waffles only had butter on top with 2 pieces of bacon! I mean cmon?! Throw some other kinds of fruit and whipped cream on there too! But No! They don't do that.  If you want just a simple breakfast, then come here.

g91xszYmn4vfqt_3oPemRg.text: Finally made it there...excited a location opened near me(Rio Salado). I am a weekend, breakfast fan. Matt's service staff was great. My choice of food election was not as remarkable. Eggs, potatoes, veggie mix-ins, were sort of bland and lacking texture. Will try again in future...other options.

eim9NlkhLeeDBAXglyq95w.text: Average food and service. We like the one down town better. Tempe store doesn't seem to have fresh ingredients like the down town store does.

rJ2kx0Tgrbp8GooufP9RXA.text: Well, for a place that has "Big Breakfast" in it's name, I think they missed the boat.  First off, the menu only listed 10 breakfast plates, so the "Big" in their name couldn't possibly mean the number of breakfast items.  In fact, the only thing on my plate that was big was the Hash Browns, the greasy Hash Browns.  The bacon I placed on the plate where the Hash Browns were, ended up floating in the Hash Brown grease.  The Hash Browns were also a strange grease/oily color, not your typical crispy  brown from the griddle.  Despite the level of the grease, the insides were soft.  The 2 eggs over easy were done properly, but the coffee wasn't all too tasty.  Possibly, if I had ordered pancakes, they may have been big, so that may affect my review, but others in my wife's group all felt their meal was sub par and greasy.   Finally, the server told me they don't serve cream for your coffee.  What?  No cream?  Nope, just milk (and I am unsure if it was even whole milk because it took a lot of milk to lighten up my otherwise so-so coffee).  Rise Up Dairy Farmers and complain about that!! While the blueberry jam they provided was tasty, it just couldn't wipe the greasy flavor out of my mouth.

PJ6dF2cd55SxHspLEjDYaw.text: The food was as good as the original downtown location.  Service was solid.  This location is trendy and much larger than the other locations.  I will be a regular!

TfXvsVZvinpn-JLc_2tHVw.text: Bit of a mixed bag experience here. I thought there were two separate lines for take out vs getting seated to dine in, so unfortunately we got passed up a few times before we got a table. Service was ok initially but we ended up waiting a very long time (maybe 40 minutes?) for our food. We flagged down another server once we noticed several tables who arrived after us were getting their food.  Someone came back to our table and told us our order had been lost and they had to take it again! Our original server never came back to our table once our order had to be re-taken but others came by to check on us several times.   In the end, the food was very delicious and our bill was taken care of but I probably won't be bringing my future mother in law back here ever again... I understand that mistakes happen but kinda disappointed that our original server didn't seem to notice or care how long we had to wait for our food even after we made them other servers aware of it.   I'll give this place another try with my bf instead cos the food was so good

My boyfriend got the steak and eggs cooked to perfection and my friend got the special of the day that she was happy with. I was actually surprised that refills on soda are not free. I thought it was an April fools joke but apparently not! 7iUQR7XMb-EARKxHWN3Itw.text: A delicious meal and a smile is definitely what I needed today! I was having a bad day, and needed to get a quick bite. From moment I walked in, the staff was helpful and positive. My order only took about 10 minutes, and was given to me with a smile. Just from the customer service alone, I would return to this place. As for the food, you have to try it for yourself! Cooked just right for me and smells amazing! Great job to the morning staff of Mike's Big Breakfast!

OAZLKPGnZjMTRFVRjGU8LA.text: Delicious! Everything was made from scratch and taste homemade. I would definitely recommend giving Matts a try, you won't be disappointed. The service was great! (Art took great care of us).

D0FOix0n7srRx6smiEG5WQ.text: What a treasure! Warm hospitality, absolutely delicious, fresh ingredients with a real homemade taste. Definitely recommend.

R0TSHv_esd-bhMdumF4eKQ.text: First, Matt's "Big" Breakfast is quite an overstatement.  It's medium at best.  They also have no reasonable low carb options and everything comes with potatoes and toast.  No creamer for your coffee.  Seriously?  I don't mean they were out, I mean they don't provide it to their customers.  Ok so I'll have a soda.  Soda machine is broken.  I had the pork chop and eggs, and the steak knife they brought was by far the largest thing on the plate.  The chop had zero seasoning, was undercooked, tiny and chewy.  All this for $13.  Rip off.  The young lady who served us was very nice; she was the only positive aspect of this  experience and I will go hungry before ever going back to this place.

jsBri2uJ7KB3uVbqvvRgYg.text: Great breakfast spot. Amazing food at a low price. Quality ingredients and awesome service.

i6Y5Yo9CWvkq-Bveou3REw.text: This place had absolutely delicious and unique breakfast food! The service was great too. I only wish we lived closer and we'd be there all the time.
